# Battle of Virbalis

| place             = Virbalis, Russian Empire (now Lithuania)
| coordinates       =
| result            = Russian victory
| combatant1        =  Russian Empire
| combatant2        =
| commander1        =  Alexander Granikov Huseyn Khan Nakhchivanski
| commander2        = Unknown
| units1            =
| units2            = Unknown
| strength1         = 2,500
| strength2         = 10,000
| casualties1       = Unknown
| casualties2       = Heavy}}
}}
Battle of Virbalis (), was one of the largest battles of the first 16 days of the World War I, during which the parties were preparing to conduct full-scale operations.
10,000 German troops attacked 2,500 Russians on the station, the Germans wanted to destroy the train station to slow down the mobilization of the Russians, but they could not take it and had to retreat. It is the first battle of the World War 1 Eastern Front.
